course.dc:description: The attractiveness of this qualification is the wide employment opportunities it provides. The course offers a breadth and depth of specialist knowledge, as well as a range of highly marketable skills. Accounting as a subject is constantly changing in order to adapt to the needs of modern day business. The development of the BA (Hons) Accounting and Finance is continuous in order to keep pace with these changes. If you are interested in training to become an accountant or a finance specialist, this course provides an excellent foundation for professional qualifications.
course.dc:subject: Accountancy & Finance
course.dc:title: Accounting and Finance
course.abstract: The attractiveness of this qualification is the wide employment opportunities it provides. The course offers a breadth and depth of specialist knowledge, as well as a range of highly marketable skills. Accounting as a subject is constantly changing in order to adapt to the needs of modern day business. The development of the BA (Hons) Accounting and Finance is continuous in order to keep pace with these changes. If you are interested in training to become an accountant or a finance specialist, this course provides an excellent foundation for professional qualifications.

presentation.mlo:prerequisite:
GCE A/VCE A: 160 points, normally in a minimum of two subject areas.
We expect a percentage of these to be at GCE A/VCE A level. Points generated by GCE AS/VCE AS level and Key Skills qualifications, will be considered.
BTEC National Diploma:Merit Access: Pass
presentation.mlo:cost: UK fee: GBP; Overseas Fee: GBP

course.dc:description: This course is a four-year extended degree, which commences at Year 0 entry. It is designed for those students who may not meet the requirements for entry onto Level 1 of the BA (Hons) degree but who have the potential to succeed if given the extended preparation. The attractiveness of this qualification is the wide employment opportunities it provides. The course offers a breadth and depth of specialist knowledge, as well as a range of highly marketable skills. Accounting as a subject is constantly changing in order to adapt to the needs of modern day business. The development of the BA (Hons) Accounting and Finance is continuous in order to keep pace with these changes. If you are interested in training to become an accountant or a finance specialist, this course provides an excellent foundation for professional qualifications. Successful completion of this degree will open up opportunities for you to move into a position in financial accounting, management accounting or corporate finance.
course.dc:subject: Accountancy & Finance
course.dc:title: Accounting and Finance with Foundation
course.abstract: This course is a four-year extended degree, which commences at Year 0 entry. It is designed for those students who may not meet the requirements for entry onto Level 1 of the BA (Hons) degree but who have the potential to succeed if given the extended preparation. The attractiveness of this qualification is the wide employment opportunities it provides. The course offers a breadth and depth of specialist knowledge, as well as a range of highly marketable skills. Accounting as a subject is constantly changing in order to adapt to the needs of modern day business. The development of the BA (Hons) Accounting and Finance is continuous in order to keep pace with these changes. If you are interested in training to become an accountant or a finance specialist, this course provides an excellent foundation for professional qualifications. Successful completion of this degree will open up opportunities for you to move into a position in financial accounting, management accounting or corporate finance.

presentation.mlo:prerequisite: GCE A/VCE A level: 40 points, normally in a minimum of two subject areas. We expect a percentage of these to be at GCE A/VCE A level. Students must have also completed both formal years of study towards these qualifications. Points generated by GCE AS/VCE AS level and Key Skills qualifications, will be considered. Students must successfully complete Year 0 before being allowed on to Year 1 of the degree.
presentation.mlo:cost: UK fee: GBP; Overseas Fee: GBP

course.dc:description: This course is accredited by the Association of Chartered Certified Accountants (ACCA) and has been designed for anyone who works, or wishes to work, in an accounting support role. Ideal as an entry-level qualification, it will give you the opportunity to claim exemption from the ACCA's professional Foundation Level courses, should you wish to acquire further accounting qualifications.
course.dc:subject: Accountancy & Finance
course.dc:title: Accounting Technicians (CAT)
course.abstract: This course is accredited by the Association of Chartered Certified Accountants (ACCA) and has been designed for anyone who works, or wishes to work, in an accounting support role. Ideal as an entry-level qualification, it will give you the opportunity to claim exemption from the ACCA's professional Foundation Level courses, should you wish to acquire further accounting qualifications.

presentation.mlo:prerequisite: No formal entry requirements are necessary, but applicants should have good written and spoken English and basic numeracy.
presentation.mlo:cost: UK fee: GBP; Overseas Fee: GBP

course.dc:description: The Foundation Degree in Credit Management follows the syllabus and structure of the Institute of Credit Management (ICM). The course will prepare you for work in this specialised field, providing you with a solid grounding in the techniques of credit control and helping you to develop managerial capabilities.
course.dc:subject: Accountancy & Finance
Business & Management
Management
course.dc:title: Credit Management
course.abstract: The Foundation Degree in Credit Management follows the syllabus and structure of the Institute of Credit Management (ICM). The course will prepare you for work in this specialised field, providing you with a solid grounding in the techniques of credit control and helping you to develop managerial capabilities.

presentation.mlo:prerequisite: Applicants who have GCE A/VCE A level points score of at least 40, eg 1 GCE A/VCE A level or 2 GCE AS/VCE AS levels, will be considered for admission to this course. This course is designed for those already in employment who do not have a higher education qualification. Students will be considered on evidence of their ability to benefit from the course and may not have to meet the formal requirements of the University for admission.
presentation.mlo:cost: UK fee: GBP; Overseas Fee: GBP

course.dc:description: Designed for credit clerks and credit controllers, this course offers a widely recognised professional qualification to help develop managerial capabilities. It will give you a solid grounding in the skills of credit management and, once you have completed the Institute's professional qualification, you will also be able to use the designation MICM (Grad).
course.dc:subject: Accountancy & Finance
Management
course.dc:title: Credit Management
course.abstract: Designed for credit clerks and credit controllers, this course offers a widely recognised professional qualification to help develop managerial capabilities. It will give you a solid grounding in the skills of credit management and, once you have completed the Institute's professional qualification, you will also be able to use the designation MICM (Grad).

presentation.mlo:prerequisite: No formal qualifications required

presentation.mlo:prerequisite: No formal qualifications required

course.dc:description: This course will provide you with an understanding of the purposes of company accounts, accounting systems, the effects of the economic, legal and technical change on accounting, and the concepts and techniques used in accounting. On successful completion of the AS level (first year) students can progress onto the A2 level (second year) to make a full A-level. The AS can also be taken part-time.
course.dc:subject: Accountancy & Finance
course.dc:title: Accounting
course.abstract: This course will provide you with an understanding of the purposes of company accounts, accounting systems, the effects of the economic, legal and technical change on accounting, and the concepts and techniques used in accounting. On successful completion of the AS level (first year) students can progress onto the A2 level (second year) to make a full A-level. The AS can also be taken part-time.

mlo:qualification.dc:title: Advanced Subsidiary Level (Year One of A Level)

presentation.mlo:prerequisite: Normally 5 GCSEs, A* to C grades including Mathematics and English.
Normally 5 GCSEs, A* to C grades including Mathematics and English.

course.dc:description: This part-time AAT course provides practical training at 3 levels (Foundation, Intermediate and Technician) for those wishing to pursue a career in accounting. Some students start at Foundation level (NVQ2), which covers manual and computerised book-keeping. Students with previous experience of working in an accounting office can start at Intermediate level (NVQ3), which has an introduction to Financial and Management accounts. A Modern Apprenticeship Framework is available for 16-24 year olds in full-time employment. The AAT course provides a widely recognised qualification in its own right and also provides a sound base for those wishing to pursue further studies with ACCA and CIMA.
course.dc:subject: Accountancy & Finance
course.dc:title: Accounting - AAT Foundation
course.abstract: This part-time AAT course provides practical training at 3 levels (Foundation, Intermediate and Technician) for those wishing to pursue a career in accounting. Some students start at Foundation level (NVQ2), which covers manual and computerised book-keeping. Students with previous experience of working in an accounting office can start at Intermediate level (NVQ3), which has an introduction to Financial and Management accounts. A Modern Apprenticeship Framework is available for 16-24 year olds in full-time employment. The AAT course provides a widely recognised qualification in its own right and also provides a sound base for those wishing to pursue further studies with ACCA and CIMA.

presentation.mlo:prerequisite:
AAT Foundation - No formal qualifications required, but appropriate numerical and communication skills are needed. AAT Intermediate - Students should either have passed AAT Foundation or another course containing book-keeping or have several years experience working in an accounting office. AAT Technician - Students should have passed AAT Intermediate
Full details of entry requirements and regulations should be obtained from the AAT (Tel 020 7837 8600)
presentation.mlo:cost: UK fee: GBP495; Overseas Fee: GBP1230

course.dc:description: The Foundation Accounting course gives you an introduction to manual and computerised book-keeping and will prepare you for higher level accounting studies and for working in an accounting office.
course.dc:subject: Accountancy & Finance
course.dc:title: Accounting - AAT Foundation (OCR)
course.abstract: The Foundation Accounting course gives you an introduction to manual and computerised book-keeping and will prepare you for higher level accounting studies and for working in an accounting office.

presentation.mlo:prerequisite: No formal entry requirements, but students should have reasonable numerical ability and enjoy working with numbers.

course.dc:description: The AAT Fast track course enables students to cover both AAT Certificate) and AAT Intermediate - NVQ Level 3 Accounting qualifications in a single year. It is a practical course with both a classroom and a computer element, which prepares students for a job in an accounting office. It also prepares students for further study on AAT advanced courses and later ACCA or CIMA.
course.dc:subject: Accountancy & Finance
course.dc:title: Accounting - AAT Foundation and Intermediate
course.abstract: The AAT Fast track course enables students to cover both AAT Certificate) and AAT Intermediate - NVQ Level 3 Accounting qualifications in a single year. It is a practical course with both a classroom and a computer element, which prepares students for a job in an accounting office. It also prepares students for further study on AAT advanced courses and later ACCA or CIMA.

presentation.mlo:prerequisite: Students should have or expect to achieve 5 x GCSE Grade A-C. Students without these qualifications can study on the Accounts Foundation course (CC010), which covers the same topics but at a slower speed. Students will enjoy the course if they have an aptitude for working with numbers.

course.dc:description: This part-time AAT course provides practical training at 3 levels (Foundation, Intermediate and Technician) for those wishing to pursue a career in accounting. Some students start at Foundation level (NVQ2), which covers manual and computerised book-keeping. Students with previous experience of working in an accounting office can start at Intermediate level (NVQ3), which has an introduction to Financial and Management accounts. A Modern Apprenticeship Framework is available for 16-24 year olds in full-time employment. The AAT course provides a widely recognised qualification in its own right and also provides a sound base for those wishing to pursue further studies with ACCA and CIMA.

course.dc:description: This is a fast track course offering an introduction to book-keeping practices. The aim is to provide a fundamental understanding of the principles of double entry in the context of both manual and computerised processes.
